intro: Leontodon hispidus subsp. opimus, commonly known as the hairy toothgrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and linear, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk. It is often found in open habitats and is relatively common in its native range.
